author: TEDx Talks
description:
A driverless future is within reach and AI holds the promise of safe transportation for all.  But with biases inherent in the data used to program the cars of the future, is AI really ready to drive in urban and rural settings?  And what do we need to do to make an inclusive future a reality? 

A "recovering engineer" and "geek lawyer," Jennifer Dukarski leads Butzel’s Automated and Connected Vehicle Team.  She focuses her legal practice where technology, communications, and mobility meet.  A leader in the area of automated vehicles, she negotiated some of the first robotaxi agreements in the world.  A champion of the responsible use of AI, she regularly advises and teaches on AI risk mitigation.  She was named one of the 30 Women Defining the Future of Technology by Warner Communications for her innovative thoughts and contributions to the tech industry. 

This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more
title: Why are driverless cars still so bad at driving? | Jennifer Dukarski | TEDxDetroit

author: TEDx Talks
description:
After accumulating millions of followers, The Minimalists quit social media for a year. This is what they learned. Emmy-nominated Netflix stars and New York Times–bestselling authors Joshua Fields Millburn, Ryan Nicodemus, and T.K. Coleman, known collectively as The Minimalists, “show their followers how to streamline their lives to find more happiness” (Good Morning America). With the “charm of their buddy-act, The Minimalists have become the minimalist movement’s American ringleaders” (New York Magazine).

These “sincere prophets of anti-consumerism” (The New Yorker) have been featured in Time, Architectural Digest, and GQ, and they have spoken at Harvard, Apple, and Google. The Minimalists Podcast, with more than 140 million downloads, is one of the most popular podcasts in the world. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Scrolling Is the New Smoking | The Minimalists | TEDxFargo

author: TEDx Talks
description: What if one of the most powerful climate solutions is hiding in our dirtiest water? An innovative entrepreneur examines how industrial wastewater from mines, refineries, power plants, and more holds vast stores of critical minerals and rare earth elements that we need for renewable energy. Instead of polluting our air and draining our freshwater, new technologies can extract these minerals, reclaiming wastewater to accelerate the clean-energy transition. It’s a vision for a future where the industries that once caused pollution become essential partners in solving the climate crisis.   Lacey is passionate about finding solutions that improve human-environmental interactions and increase clean water access for vulnerable communities. Lacey serves as the Founder and CEO of Olokun Minerals focused on recovering critical minerals and valuable materials as well as clean water from wastewater streams. Lacey has a degree in mathematics from Spelman College and a degree in civil engineering w
title: Turning our biggest polluters into our biggest renewers | Lacey Reddix | TEDxSaltLakeCity

author: TEDx Talks
description: Star gazers all over the world are having their view of the night sky increasingly disrupted by light pollution. In this talk, Dr. Daniel Mendoza illuminates how preserving dark skies through simple solutions can preserve energy, lower carbon emissions, and benefit wildlife and human health. Dr. Daniel Mendoza holds joint appointments as Research Associate Professor in the Department of Atmospheric Sciences and Adjunct Associate Professor in the Pulmonary Division in the School of Medicine, and the Department of City & Metropolitan Planning at the University of Utah. He quantifies the health effects of acute and chronic pollutant exposure. He is the Director of the Dark Sky Studies Minor and instructor of the Capstone Class at the University of Utah. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Flip the switch to stop light pollution | Dr. Daniel Mendoza | TEDxSaltLakeCity

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In her speech, Devanshi Arun explores the symbolism of scissors as tools of choice, change, and fate. She reflects on how seemingly small decisions—like a childhood haircut—can shape lives, highlighting their metaphorical significance and the importance of discerning what to “cut” or “hold on to” in personal and societal contexts. Devanshi Arun, a 15-year- old student leader, debater, and public speaker from Our Own Sharjah girls, is passionate about using words to inspire
awareness and action. In her TEDx talk, “The Dangerous Invention,” she redefines danger—not in bombs or weapons, but in everyday choices. Using the metaphor of scissors, she explores how small actions can divide or heal, urging us to choose connection over
destruction. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Cut to the truth | Devaanshi Arun | TEDxGEMS OOEHS Girls Sharjah Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description:
Jewel Jacob’s speech explores body image, societal standards, and weight stigma, using personal experience and Oprah Winfrey’s story. It emphasizes that failure often stems from external expectations, not the individual, and advocates sustainable self-care, small wins, and self-compassion. Ultimately, it urges embracing diversity, rejecting imposed molds, and living authentically. Jewel, a passionate public
speaker from Our Own Sharjah girls, believes
deeply in the power of words to
create awareness and inspire
change. In her TEDx talk, “The
Dress That Didn’t Fit,” she
explores themes of body image,
self-worth, and the silent
struggles many face in pursuit of
acceptance. Through personal
stories and gentle humor, she
reminds us that true confidence
comes not from fitting in, but
from embracing who we are,
unapologetically.. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: The Dress | Jewel Mariam Jacob | TEDxGEMS OOEHS Girls Sharjah Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description: Mr. Sahil Nayar explains how inner calm and quiet thinking have become powerful strengths in today’s noisy world. He proposes techniques to cultivate presence, clarity, and emotional balance. Mr. Sahil Nayar is a renowned HR Thought Leader and Influencer, widely recognized for his innovative contributions to the HR and Learning & Development (L&D) fraternity. He has been honored with the prestigious Top HR Voice Award on LinkedIn — a testament to his influence and dedication within the professional community. Mr. Nayar is a regular columnist and a visiting faculty at several leading business schools across India, where he shares insights on leadership, organizational behavior, and personal development.With his energetic and forward-thinking approach, Sahil continues to inspire individuals and organizations to embrace growth, empathy, and innovation in the ever-evolving world of work. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a l
title: Mastering Quiet – The New Superpower | Sahil Nayar | TEDxCGC Mohali

author: TEDx Talks
description: Układasz, czy oglądasz? Bo to od Ciebie zależy jaką stronę muzycznej układanki wybierzesz! Chcesz dowiedzieć się w jaki sposób ludzki umysł reaguje na muzykę? Dlaczego nasz nastrój zmienia się pod wpływem ulubionych utworów? Jak samemu kształtować emocje u odbiorców? Jak nauka gry na instrumencie pozytywnie wpływa na nasz rozwój? Na te wszystkie pytania odpowie w swojej prelekcji Bartłomiej Bogdan. Bartłomiej Bogdan - człowiek wielu pasji i talentów: multiinstrumentalista, aranżer, dyrygent, wokalista, pedagog, kolekcjoner wyposażenia wojskowego i mundurów oraz taktyczny krawiec - amator. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Muzyczna układanka - co wybierasz? | Bartłomiej Bogdan: | TEDxLublin

author: TEDx Talks
description: Tanvir Ahmed Teyder explores why entrepreneurship goes far beyond profit and products, highlighting its deeper role in solving problems, creating impact, and inspiring change. He shares how entrepreneurial thinking can transform communities and empower individuals to lead with purpose, resilience, and vision. Tanvir Ahmed Teyder is the Founder of EnglishBoli, a platform dedicated to making English education accessible to everyone in Bangladesh. Realizing how English opened doors to global opportunities, he taught himself skills like graphic design, marketing, and web development from YouTube. During his time at North South University, he earned 60,000-1,20,000 BDT per month through freelancing for local and international clients. His journey inspired him to create EnglishBoli, helping others overcome language barriers and unlock their potential to build better futures through the power of English. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently or
title: Why Entrepreneurship Is More Than Just Business? | Tanvir Ahmed Teyder | TEDxDhanmondi

author: TEDx Talks
description: Discover My Emergency Triage (PCM), a personal emotional coping ritual developed by Joanna Lilian Zachariah. It uses a pillow, ceiling, and mirror to help process feelings, face fears, and improve relationships by naming emotions and seeking support, emphasizing how such rituals offer essential emotional triage and promote healing. Joanna Lilian, a Grade 12 student from GEMS Millennium Sharjah, is deeply passionate about psychology, storytelling, and understanding the human experience. Aspiring to blend medicine with psychology, she hopes to care for both the body and the mind. Beyond academics, Joanna finds joy in music, RJ-ing, swimming, and capturing life’s moments through her lens. In her TEDx talk, “My Emergency Triage – PCM,” she shares how confronting her emotions taught her that opening up is one of the bravest things we can do—a reminder that vulnerability is strength in its purest form. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently org
title: My Emergency Triage (PCM) | Joanna Lilian Zachariah | TEDxGEMS OOEHS Girls Sharjah Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In “More Than Ink,” Grace Jean shows how a simple pen helped her reflect on thoughts, creativity, and ambitions. Acting as a mirror to her authentic self, it encouraged honesty over performance. Connecting this to extended cognition, she demonstrates how everyday objects can shape thinking and even influence the stories we live. Grace Jean is a 15-year-old
student at GEMS Legacy School,
Dubai, who loves turning
ordinary moments into ideas
worth sharing. Through writing
and public speaking, she
explores stories that spark
curiosity and connection. She is
also an active debater and
speaker who has a flair for
classic literature. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: More Than Ink | Grace Jean | TEDxGEMS OOEHS Girls Sharjah Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description:
When Farhan was eight, he climbed into a sweltering attic in Bangladesh and found my cousin secretly building a radio out of garbage.
Not because he had resources.
Not because anyone told him to.
But because nobody told him he couldn’t.

This TEDx talk is about the moment we stop waiting for permission and start building our lives with our own hands.

As the talk unfolds, he construct a functioning radio live on stage. It becomes a metaphor for something far bigger: the courage to create, dismantle, rebuild, and reconnect with our innate maker instincts.

? In this talk, you’ll experience:
        •        The attic discovery that changed how I saw possibility
        •        The “beautiful destroyer” phase — taking everything apart because curiosity demanded it
        •        The corporate internship that numbered me as “Employee 447” and tried to block me from learning
        •        The robotic hand built under a desk — an act of quiet rebellion
        •        The neuroscien
title: Why you don't need permission to build | Farhan Hossain | TEDxMilpitas

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In “The Weight I Carried,” Meeca Lolith uses the metaphor of a bag to show how societal expectations burden girls from birth. Critiquing performative feminism, she emphasizes true empowerment as choice, urging women to unpack judgment and fear, filling their bags with confidence, courage, and freedom to shape their own lives. Meeca Lolith is a 15-year-old student
leader and the President of the Student
Council at GEMS Legacy School. Once
shy and nervous about speaking in
front of others, she has grown into a
confident communicator who now finds
joy in public speaking. A passionate
reader, she loves exploring new ideas
through books, which continues to
shape her perspective and fuel her
creativity. Her interests extend to
environmental sustainability, gender
equality, and empowering young voices
to make a difference. Meeca’s journey
reflects her belief that challenges can
be transformed into strengths, and she
continues to inspire others through her
leadership and advocacy. This talk w
title: The Weight I Carried | Meeca Lolith | TEDxGEMS OOEHS Girls Sharjah Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description: In “Salt,” Evan Vipin explores friendship through personal anecdotes and friends’ perspectives, showing how friends shape identity and narrate one’s story with humor, support, and care. The talk emphasizes understanding these invisible narrators, appreciating the impact of relationships, and taking it all with a “mountain of salt.” Evan, a student from GEMS Millennium School, Sharjah, delivers a witty and heartfelt exploration of how friends become the invisible narrators of our lives. Through their jokes, comments, and quiet observations, they subtly shape who we are. Using humor—and a mountain of salt—as his metaphor, Evan reflects on how these moments reveal his own personality: sarcastic, caring, and authentic. Through stories of friendship, math struggles, and laughter, he reminds us that the people around us often tell our truest stories, even when we don’t realize it. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local comm
title: Salt | Evan Vipin | TEDxGEMS OOEHS Girls Sharjah Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description: Pranav Suresh’s speech explores shoes as profound metaphors for human experience, symbolizing growth, identity, and history through their intimate connection with wearers. He reflects on how shoes narrate personal journeys and significant historical events, inviting listeners to consider the stories their own shoes could tell. A creative thinker from Grade 11 at The Millennium School, Dubai, Pranav draws inspiration in art and reading, where imagination and reflection often meet. Eager to enhance his public speaking and critical thinking skills, he joined TEDx to explore new perspectives and express ideas with impact. In his talk, Pranav begins with a familiar, everyday object that holds deeper meaning—one that silently captures memories and emotions. Through this object, he beautifully embodies the theme “The Invisible Narrators – How Everyday Objects Tell Stories of Our Lives.” This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local
title: The Tales Told by Shoes  | Pranav Suresh | TEDxGEMS OOEHS Girls Sharjah Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description: Md. Abdul Quayyum explores the urgent need to “pay back to nature” by changing the way we live, consume, and think about the environment. Through personal reflections and practical insights, he highlights how restoring balance with nature is essential for a sustainable future for Bangladesh and the world. Md. Abdul Qayyum, Head of Communications at UNDP Bangladesh, has over 20 years of experience in development communications, including 10 in leadership. He has led impactful strategies in media management, digital outreach, behavior change campaigns, crisis communication, and partnership building. At UNDP, he strengthened digital presence, expanded media reach, and embedded communication as a key driver of success. With a background in Mass Communication and Journalism, he’s passionate about empowering youth and driving positive change through strategic communication, a true son of Bangladeshi soil. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently
title: Paying Back to Nature | Md. Abdul Quayyum | TEDxDhanmondi

author: TEDx Talks
description:
這支影片《臺灣海洋產業的美學與傳承》描繪了一位從零開始的創業者，如何以熱情與信念打造臺灣海洋產業的新時代。從一艘小船起步，回溯南島民族的航海精神，將對海的敬畏與熱愛轉化為推動產業的力量。他帶領團隊在十二年間掌握全臺多地港灣資源，並以環境共生為核心，讓遊艇碼頭成為海洋保育的基地。隨著事業拓展，他將藝術與科技融入餐飲產業，以AI智慧餐飲與文化美學相結合，推動地方創生與產業升級。從臺南到紐約、從部落到國際，他不僅實踐商業創新，更以文化傳承者的姿態，讓臺灣的海洋精神綻放於世界舞台。影片最後，他以「大願」作為人生信念，鼓勵觀眾勇於追夢、共創永續與美學並進的未來。

The video “The Aesthetics and Legacy of Taiwan’s Marine Industry” portrays how an entrepreneur, starting from nothing, built a new era for Taiwan’s ocean industry through passion and conviction. Beginning with a single small boat, he traces the seafaring spirit of the Austronesian peoples, transforming reverence and love for the ocean into a driving force for industry development. Over twelve years, he led his team to gain access to harbor resources across Taiwan, placing ecological coexistence at the core and turning yacht marinas into hubs for marine conservation.

As his business expanded, he integrated art and technology into the culinary field, combining AI-powered smart dining with cultural aesthetics t
title: 臺灣海洋產業的美學與傳承 | 胡竣甯 Arthur Hu | TEDxYongkang

author: TEDx Talks
description:
這支影片《靠近藝術：在AI時代養成審美力的深度分享》以演講者三十五年的藝術人生為主軸，探討在人工智慧快速發展的時代中，審美力如何成為人類最難被取代的核心能力。從早年接觸藝術的啟蒙開始，講者分享藝術如何形塑他的人生價值與思維方式，並進一步闡述藝術收藏與投資的內在邏輯。他指出，真正的審美力建立於感知、想象與解析三大能力的培養，鼓勵父母讓孩子從生活體驗、觀展、閱讀與欣賞中培養獨立判斷與品味。透過王國維「人生三重境界」的比喻，演講者詮釋藝術如何引導人們在孤獨、堅持與領悟之間成長。影片最後，他以藝術博覽會與當代藝術市場為例，強調藝術的價值不僅在商品層面，更在於滋養心靈與激發創造力，呼籲觀眾勇於靠近藝術，在審美的旅程中找到人生的熱情與方向。

The video “Approaching Art: A Deep Dive into Cultivating Aesthetic Literacy in the Age of AI” centers on the speaker’s 35-year journey in the world of art, exploring how aesthetic literacy has become one of the most irreplaceable human abilities in an era of rapidly advancing artificial intelligence. Beginning with his early encounters with art, the speaker shares how art has shaped his values and ways of thinking, and further explains the inner logic behind art collecting and art investment.

He emphasizes that true aesthetic literacy is built upon three core abilities—perception, imagination, and interpretation—and encourages parents to help their children develop inde
title: 靠近藝術：在AI時代養成審美力的深度分享 | 陸潔民 Jimmy Lu | TEDxYongkang

author: TEDx Talks
description:
這支影片《近距離看臺灣：從空中影像到在地環境教育的推廣之路》以分享者的家庭故事為起點，帶領觀眾從高空視角走向貼近土地的真實關懷。從父親創辦「看見臺灣」的宏觀紀錄出發，影片揭示數十年來空拍影像背後的環境變遷與教育使命。面對拍攝成本、法規與保存挑戰，團隊將龐大的空中資料轉化為推動環境教育的能量，讓學生透過影像重新認識家鄉、理解自然與人之間的連結。透過雲林、花蓮等地的實際案例，影片探討城鄉差距、產業依賴與環境保護之間的矛盾，呈現出臺灣土地的複雜與多元面貌。最終，分享者呼籲從「高空俯瞰」轉為「近距離凝視」，以貼近生活的教育與行動，喚起更多人對土地的情感與責任，共同守護臺灣的未來。

The video “A Close Look at Taiwan: From Aerial Imagery to the Path of Environmental Education” begins with the speaker’s family story, guiding the audience from a high-altitude perspective to a grounded, heartfelt concern for the land. Starting from the large-scale documentary legacy created by the speaker’s father through Beyond Beauty: Taiwan from Above, the video reveals decades of environmental change and the educational使命 behind the aerial images.

Despite challenges such as filming costs, regulations, and archival preservation, the team has transformed immense volumes of aerial footage into powerful resources for promoting environmental education. Through these images, students rediscover thei
title: 近距離看臺灣：從空中影像到在地環境教育的推廣之路 | 齊廷洹 CHI TING HUAN | TEDxYongkang

author: TEDx Talks
description:
這支影片《教育的使命與心靈連結》以曾燦燈教授真摯的生命故事為主軸，深刻詮釋教育的本質與使命。從童年被醫師救回一命的經歷出發，他體悟「愛與同理心」才是教育最根本的力量。影片中，他結合在政治與教育現場的經驗，說明如何以親近、鼓勵與榜樣啟發學生，改變生命方向。透過偏鄉學生、放牛班、及跨文化教育案例，他展現教育的真諦在於尊重與陪伴，而非權威與成績。最後，曾教授以超過四十年的教學生涯，提醒科技的進步應回歸人與人之間的真實連結，唯有以愛為核心，教育才能真正改變世界。

The video “The Mission of Education and the Connection of the Soul” centers on Professor Tseng Tsan-Teng’s heartfelt life story, offering a profound interpretation of the essence and使命 of education. Beginning with his childhood experience of being saved by a doctor, he came to realize that love and empathy are the most fundamental forces in education.

Drawing from his experiences in both politics and frontline education, he explains how closeness, encouragement, and leading by example can inspire students and transform the course of their lives. Through stories involving rural students, underperforming classes, and cross-cultural education, he demonstrates that the true meaning of education lies in respect and companionship, rather than authority or grades.
title: 教育的使命與心靈連結 | 曾燦燈 Tsahn Deng Tseng | TEDxYongkang

author: TEDx Talks
description:
這支影片《舞動生命的光》深刻記錄了編舞家蔡博丞從生命創傷中重生、以舞蹈療癒世界的歷程。從父親病逝的痛苦中萌芽，他以水燈為意象創作出《浮花》，將思念化為流動的力量，並以此作獲得德國漢諾威編舞大賽觀眾票選獎與製作獎，讓臺灣舞蹈在國際舞台發光。隨後他成立 B.DANCE 丞舞製作團隊，秉持「一個人可以走得快，但一群人可以走得遠」的信念，凝聚跨領域專業者，持續推動藝術創作與社會參與。他帶領團隊走遍全球25國、128城，將現代舞延伸至教育、公益與時尚產業，開創屬於臺灣的舞蹈語彙。影片展現蔡博丞如何用藝術跨越傷痛、連結人心，證明舞蹈不只是肢體的表達，更是一種靈魂的語言，療癒、共感、啟發，並讓世界看見臺灣文化的柔軟與堅韌。

The video “The Light That Dances Through Life” profoundly captures choreographer Po-Cheng Tsai’s journey of rebirth from personal trauma and his mission to heal the world through dance. Born from the sorrow of his father’s passing, he created Floating Flowers, inspired by the imagery of water lanterns—transforming grief into a flowing, luminous force. The work earned him both the Audience Award and the Production Award at the Hanover International Choreography Competition in Germany, bringing Taiwanese dance into the global spotlight.

He later founded B.DANCE, guided by the belief that “one may walk fast alone, but a group can go far together.” Uniting professionals across multip
title: 舞動生命的光 | 蔡博丞 TSAI, Po-Cheng | TEDxYongkang

author: TEDx Talks
description:
The speaker depicts changes in one's life, especially that of a woman, through an artistic perspective. She relates the daily routine to 'Navras', or 'the nine emotions'. Her talk depicts life and it's ever changing rhythm through the rhythm of Indian Classical beats, poses, cultural references and graceful movements. Dr. Roli Bhardwaj began her Kathak journey at the tender age of 4 under the guidance of Professor Kailash Nath Shrivastava, a disciple of the legendary Kathak Guru Shri Shambhu Maharaj Ji (Lucknow Gharana). Alongside Kathak, she pursued formal training in Tabla and Bhav Sangeet, earning a Visharad degree in both.
Professional Journey
• Served as an ‘A’ Grade Artist under the Ministry of Culture, Government of India (6 years).
• Mentored several disciples who are now professional performers and dance educators nationally and internationally.
• Conducted workshops, lecture-demonstrations, and seminars in schools, colleges, and universities across India.
• Performed at pres
title: Nine Emotions. Infinite Stories. One Rhythm. | Dr. Roli Bhardwaj | TEDxMody University

author: TEDx Talks
description: The speaker shares her story of being an anxious kid with self-doubt. Growing up she faced several moments of returning to her shell, and hiding behind her walls, before facing and overcoming each obstacle. Her story inspires that change isn't absolute when it comes to yourself, it's a constant challenge that you need to keep showing up for. An inspiring global educator and specialist in phonics and cognitive development, Ms. Shivani Bajaj shares her journey from being a shy, introverted child — often bullied — to becoming a confident leader shaping young minds. Her story exemplifies resilience, transformation, and the courage to find one’s own rhythm of confidence and change. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Shy to Shine | Shivani Bajaj | TEDxMody University

author: TEDx Talks
description: In his TEDx Talk, he focuses on how comparison between 2 persons can help a person positively to improve his/her skills.  Saadhuryan G D, a 6th grader of KRM Public School, India who dreams of becoming a singer in the near future. He truly believes that learning from mistakes is the first step towards success. He is also a happy Scout, always ready to help others. His grandfather inspired his love for singing, and his parents keep him motivated—they’re the fuel that keeps him moving toward his dreams. When he’s not singing, he loves reading books and magazines or creating crafts. People know him for his public speaking skills and strong imagination. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Echo of Comparison | SAADHURYAN G.D | TEDxYouth@KRMPublicSchool

author: TEDx Talks
description:
The speaker shares her struggle story of building life in a chaotic city. She faces several challenges that make her want to quit, but ultimately she decides to stay. Her story is a message that if brave enough to stay, change will be a rhythmic part of life. Constant, and hard to face at times, but not impossible. Minu Singh Joshi is a psychologist, life coach, and author of the book “Self-Nurturance: Route to Emotional Wellbeing and Resilience.” She is widely recognized for her integrative approach, blending contemporary psychology with timeless Indian wisdom to support individuals in cultivating emotional strength, clarity, and inner balance.

Areas of Expertise
• Depression & Anxiety
• Self-worth & Relationship Challenges
• Trauma Healing
• Purpose Exploration
• Holistic Growth & Resilience
Alongside therapy, Minu provides life coaching for individuals seeking clarity, conscious alignment, and purposeful living. She offers a compassionate and grounded space for people to rediscove
title: The Courage To Stay: In Rhythm With Change | Minu Singh Joshi | TEDxMody University

author: TEDx Talks
description: In her talk on ‘Breaking the Procrastination Cycle’ - a struggle nearly everyone can resonate with, Shreenithi aims to empower her audience to overcome delay, rediscover the power of action, and unlock their full potential. S Shreenithi, a passionate business stream student , KRM Public School, Chennai, India whose journey beautifully blends creativity and precision. She aspires to pursue her career as a Chartered Accountant and her strong aptitude in mathematics reflects her analytical mind. Beyond academics, she's a confident public speaker who has won several prizes in elocution and other competitions, admired for her exceptional accent, articulate expression, and confident stage presence. She draws constant support and inspiration from her family, with her sister’s guidance, her father’s wisdom, and her mother’s boldness shaping her confidence, creativity, and drive. She’s also good at arts like singing, drawing, and public speaking. She loves reading books, exploring new ideas, a
title: Breaking The Procrastination Cycle | SHREENITHI S | TEDxYouth@KRMPublicSchool

author: TEDx Talks
description: dream of a girl to enter into the male dominated sports . S. SANKEERTHANA an 8th grader is a passionate and determined young achiever who shines in both academics and sports. Her heart belongs to sports — especially cricket, which she dreams of taking up as her future career. She has played and excelled in several sports, winning medals and certificates that reflect her hard work and spirit. Cricket isn’t just a game to her — it’s her dream, her passion, and her purpose. Besides being a sports lover, Sankeerthana is a talented singer with a soulful and confident voice. Now, standing on the grand and prestigious TEDx stage, she uses her voice to speak about an issue that touched her deeply —why women are still restricted or discouraged from playing sports? Through her talk, she hopes to inspire a world where every girl can dream big, play freely, and achieve without boundaries. Her journey reflects her passion, courage, and belief that with determination, dreams can truly cross every b
title: "DREAMS OUTSIDE THE BOUNDARY" | SANKEERTHANA s | TEDxYouth@KRMPublicSchool

author: TEDx Talks
description:
This TED-style student talk explores “The Psychology of Procrastination” — why we delay tasks, how our brain responds to pressure, and simple techniques to overcome procrastination. Presented by a Grade 10 student of Aachi Global School, this talk aims to inspire students to understand their habits and take better control of their time and motivation.

In this talk, you will learn:

Why students procrastinate

How procrastination affects the brain

The role of fear and perfectionism

How to build productive habits

Practical strategies to stop delaying tasks

About the Event:
This talk was part of our school's TEDx Youth event, organized to encourage students to share innovative ideas, build confidence, and develop public speaking skills. Rinoshah Sherfrose Khan is a passionate Grade 10 IGCSE student at Aachi Global School, Chennai. She is curious about the human mind and behavior, which inspired her to explore the topic “The Psychology of Procrastination.” As a young thinker and lear
title: THE PSYCHOLOGY OF PROCRASTINATION | Rinoshah Sherfrose Khan | TEDxAachi Global School Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description: In her TEDx Talk, she shares the importance and benefit of Stories in one's life. She strongly believes stories are rich source of enormous learning.  V. Sahasra, a ninth grader, is a multi-talented individual who believes that anything can be achieved with patience and perseverance. Once an introvert, she was inspired and encouraged by her family to step out of her comfort zone and embrace public speaking with confidence. A passionate singer and skilled drummer, who also excels academically. Her love for stories began at the age of three, exploring different genres with enthusiasm. She even reflects on the comprehension passages she reads in exams, analyzing them like a true storyteller. A “story maniac” at heart, Sahasra constantly learns and grows from the morals she discovers through every tale she encounters This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. title: Lessons that live: Learning beyond words | SAHASRA V | TEDxYouth@KRMPublicSchool

A proud NCC cadet and accomplished Karate champion, she embodies strength, focus, and resilience. Excelling in academics and devoted to social service, she is driven by a desire to explore life beyond the obvious, to question appearances, and to embrace authenticity. Known for her organized mindset and endless curiosity, Nithiya inspires those around her to look deeper, think boldly, and discover the power that lies within.
